concept.name: Open Set
concept.description: An open set is a set that does not contain its boundary points.

concept.name: Closed Set
concept.description: A closed set is a set that contains all its boundary points.

concept.name: Compact Set
concept.description: A compact set is a set for which every open cover has a finite subcover.

concept.name: Homeomorphism
concept.description: A homeomorphism is a continuous function between two topological spaces that has a continuous inverse function.

concept.name: Connected Set
concept.description: A connected set is a set that cannot be divided into two nonempty disjoint open sets.
